New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: In FY23, REA partnered with Amaze to participate in developing the A Plus Employment Program. Amaze received a Victorian Government Grant to complete a two-year program of work developing a positive employment program for employers to embed in its businesses to support Autism inclusion in the workplace. Over the next two years, REA will support Amaze in shaping, testing and delivering learning modules, a job board, an employer support line and a community of practice that will help businesses prepare to hire neurodivergent talent and support those employees throughout their journey with an employer.
column20: Amaze, A Plus Employment Program, Victorian Government Grant

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: In FY23, REA expanded its entry programs with the Marketing Graduate Program, recruiting three graduates who completed rotations to establish a well-rounded marketing career. The program received nearly 2,000 applications, a 77% increase from FY22 for 14 available positions.
column20: Marketing Graduate Program, marketing career, entry program

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: REA established strategic partnerships with Explore Careers to focus on its long-term talent pipeline. Explore Careers is a leading platform for early learning and career success in Australia. Over a 12-month partnership, REA and Explore Careers collaborate to support students pursuing science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) careers.
column20: Explore Careers, talent pipeline, strategic partnership

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: Hatch is an essential partner for REA, helping pipeline talent for REA's internships and graduate programs. Hatch's personalised and technology-driven platform matches REA's values with high-quality, early-career candidates, making it a crucial talent pool for REA's entry-level programs.
column20: Hatch, internship, graduate program

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: REA recognised the need to address people's higher expectations and demands by using its Employee Value Proposition (EVP) as a strategic tool to engage REA's current workforce and connect with future talent. In FY23, REA introduced REAx and Financial Services EVP Talent Segments to attract suitable talent.
column20: Employee Value Proposition, strategic tool, future talent

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: In FY23, REA invested significantly in AI technology to create a seamless and intelligent career experience for its people. The result was the implementation of 'Talent Marketplace,' a central hub for up-to-date skill and experience data for candidates, alumni, and employees. This platform plays a key role in shaping REA's next-generation organisation and revolutionising the way current and future REA employees will experience their careers.
column20: Talent Marketplace, AI, career experience

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
Parental leave
column13: REA's leave policy offers all employees the opportunity to take time off to rest, recharge, and attend to their personal needs, regardless of their background or personal circumstances. In January 2023, REA amended its leave policy to allow employees to work on public holidays and take a day off in lieu to celebrate religious or cultural holidays.
column20: Leave policy, public holiday, religious holiday

column6: Parental leave
column13: REA's gender-inclusive parental leave policy offers equal opportunities for primary and secondary caregivers. Primary caregivers receive 20 weeks of leave, a six-week return-to-work payment, and 12 months of superannuation contributions. Secondary caregivers get six weeks of paid leave and six weeks of superannuation contributions.
column20: Parental leave policy, primary caregiver, secondary caregiver

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
Occupation health and safety management system
column13: In FY23, REA's Work, Health & Safety (WHS) system has evolved through extensive consultation. WHS Standards were approved, and WHS inspections were conducted across all offices.
column20: WHS system, consultation, standard

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: REA continued its Mental Health First Aid and Well-being Champions Networks and participated in Mental Health Month and Well-being Week as a member of the Corporate Mental Health Alliance Australia. REA continued to partner with Circle In to support REA parents and caregivers, expanding its subscriber base from 115 to 245 caregivers and managers of caregivers. The refreshed well-being strategy will be implemented in FY24, targeting key barriers to achieving well-being.
column20: Mental Health First Aid, Well-being Champions Network, Mental Health Month

column6: Occupational health services
column13: In the post-pandemic environment, REA has a well-established hybrid working model outlined in The Way We Work Ã¢ÂÂ a Guide to Hybrid Working. REA continuously assesses and enhances this approach based on employee feedback and business performance, aligning with its culture.
column20: Hybrid working model, The Way We Work, employee feedback

column6: Occupational health services
column13: The 'Respect and Resilience' program was first launched in March 2022 in partnership with the Society of Consumer Affairs Professionals (SOCAP) Australia to support customer-facing employees in handling incidents effectively. It ensures that the well-being, safety, and mental health of employees remain a priority.
column20: Respect and Resilience, SOCAP Australia, mental health

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: In FY23, REA's Hybrid Working Survey data revealed that 92% of employees view REA's hybrid working model as effective, showing a 2% annual increase. Initiatives supporting hybrid work in FY23 included the introduction of an Employee Mobility Policy and a Productivity Framework.
column20: Hybrid Working Survey, Employee Mobility Policy, Productivity Framework

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: REA's mandatory annual compliance refresher training was overhauled to cover essential WHS topics, including ergonomic setup, psychological health, safety scenarios, and legal requirements. It ensures that employees are well-prepared to handle hazards, maintain well-being, and comply with regulations.
column20: Compliance refresher training, WHS topic, ergonomic setup

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: REA's annual engagement survey in Australia seeks employee feedback on key factors of the employee experience. The results provide insights into their feelings about working at REA, highlighting strengths and areas for improvement. In FY23, participation decreased to 83% from 90% in FY22; however, it remains above the 80% industry benchmark. REA's total engagement score of 87% is consistent with the previous year and reflects a positive overall experience for REA's people.
column20: Engagement survey, employee experience, improvement

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: REA's revised Fuel Card Policy now incorporates WHS requirements, ensuring employee safety while operating vehicles.
column20: Fuel Card Policy, WHS requirement, employee safety

column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
column13: REA's new supplier onboarding system, OneTrust, now considers WHS criteria when approving contractors and suppliers, prioritising adherence to safety standards.
column20: OneTrust, supplier onboarding system, contractor

column6: Work-related injuries

Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In FY23, REA sponsored Grad Girls, a free 8-month program designed to give feminine-identifying tertiary students undertaking an ESTEAM (Environment, Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics) degree the chance to learn more about careers in tech, attend events, meet female leaders in the market and get access to internships and employment opportunities. This program is run by VIC (Victoria) ICT for Women.
column20: Grad Girls, ESTEAM degree, tertiary student

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: REA continued to run its Springboard program in FY23, which aims to support women changing careers into technology. They learn on the job through a 12-month program, and REA supports them with nine months of formal training through the Holberton School. Through this program, they rotate through different aspects of tech and, upon graduation, are offered an Associate Developer position.
column20: Springboard, technology, Holberton School

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In FY23, the REA India hackathon was focused on using AI to solve process or productivity challenges. The winning ideas were fraud detection and prevention using digital footprinting and machine-learning models, as well as using voice call analysis to collect insights.
column20: REA India Hackathon, AI, fraud detection

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: The tech kick-off (TKO) is an annual event that brings REA's Tech, UX, Design and Product communities together to focus on strategy, celebrate successes, inspire and learn. It provides opportunities for peer learning and collaborative innovation.
column20: Tech kick-off, peer learning, collaborative innovation

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In FY23, REA's Residential Property Advertising team held SparkFest for the first time, encouraging all employees to share their innovative ideas about how REA can continue to provide the best value for REA's customers. Over 150 ideas were submitted, and several of these progressed to concept testing for inclusion in future product roadmaps.
column20: SparkFest, product roadmap, innovative idea

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: REA Group was invited to attend the News Corp Global Technology AI Hackathon at Princeton, USA. This Hackathon brought together teams worldwide to focus on creativity, collaboration, and cutting-edge AI solutions. It was attended by over 100 AI enthusiasts, programmers, data scientists, product managers, designers, technology leaders, and innovators from diverse backgrounds and skill sets.
column20: Global Technology AI Hackathon, programmer, data scientist

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: As part of REA's Women in Tech initiatives for FY23, REA conducted interviews with 73 women in REA Australia Technology teams, highlighting that being part of an inclusive squad was a significant motivator. As a result, REA launched Inclusive Behaviours training and established coaching circles for women in tech.
column20: Women in Tech, inclusive squad, Inclusive Behaviour training

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: REA University (REA-U) is REA's learning platform, offering eight specialised schools focusing on various disciplines, including Self, Business, Leadership, Technology, Product, Design, Sales, and Finance. It is a place where everyone can learn, teach, and grow. Additionally, REA-U provides mandatory compliance training and access to discounted RMIT Online Future Skills courses.
column20: REA University, learning platform, compliance training

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: REA Australia's senior leadership team - the RLG - came together at an annual leadership conference to drive strategy and culture. In 2023, the conference focused on an in-depth exploration of market conditions, strategy delivery and driving a high-performance culture.
column20: Leadership conference, senior leadership team, high-performance culture
